meanings.definition: To change the direction or position of something.
meanings.sent1: She reoriented the map to face north.
meanings.sent2: After getting lost, he reoriented himself and found his way back.
meanings.sent3: The confused cat reoriented itself after spinning in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her goals were reoriented towards a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle reoriented itself towards the magnetic north pole.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or perspective.
meanings.sent1: He reoriented his study habits to improve his grades.
meanings.sent2: After the move, she reoriented herself to the new neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The robot reoriented its sensors to detect the incoming threat.
meanings.sent4: The team reoriented their strategy for the final match.
meanings.sent5: The plant reoriented its leaves towards the sunlight for optimal growth.
